syllabus:
Learning objectives:

This course aims to introduce you to the basics of interpersonal communication and public speaking. In particular, emphasis will be placed on audience analysis, outlining, designing and delivering a range of speeches. In addition, skills in overcoming nervousness, developing confidence and dynamic verbal profile in oral presentations will be covered.

From this course:

1\. Students will be able to learn the effective techniques to control nervousness;

2\. Students will be able to learn the art of mind-mapping, brainstorming, and outlining

Class schedule:

1\. Introduction: speaking in public

2\. Ethics and public speaking; listening

3\. Giving your first speech; selecting a topic and a purpose I

4\. Selecting a topic and a purpose II

5\. Analyzing the audience

6\. Gathering materials 

7\. Supporting your ideas

8\. Midterm presentation I

9\. Midterm presentation II

10\. Organizing the body of the speech

11\. Beginning and ending the speech

12\. Outlining the speech; using language I

13\. Using language II; delivery

14\. Speaking to inform and persuade

15\. Final presentation I

16\. Final presentation II

17\. Digital learning & individual feedback

18\. Digital learning & individual feedback
